text: <extra_id_0> CBP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p300 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> integrates Raf / Rac - signaling pathways in the transcriptional induction of <extra_id_0> NF-ATc <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> during T cell activation .
<extra_id_0> NF-ATc <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , an inducibly expressed transcription factor , controls gene expression in T lymphocytes and cardiomyocytes .

We show here that the transcriptional co - activators <extra_id_0> CBP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p300 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> bind to and control the activity of the inducible N-terminal transactivation domain of <extra_id_0> NF-ATc <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , TAD-A .

Similar to the N terminal transactivation domain of <extra_id_0> c-Jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , TAD-A is inducibly phosphorylated , but this phosphorylation is dispensable for the interaction with <extra_id_0> CBP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p300 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Constitutive active versions of <extra_id_0> c-Raf <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and Rac synergistically enhance the <extra_id_0> CBP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p300 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated increase of TAD-A activity , indicating the important role <extra_id_0> CBP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p300 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> plays in the integration of T cell activation signals .

Since a mutation of <extra_id_0> CBP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> abolishing HAT activity is almost as active as wild-type <extra_id_0> CBP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in T cells , functions of <extra_id_0> CBP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p300 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> other than histone acetylation appear to control the NF-AT - dependent transcription in T cells .
